DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine weather use warm ( body temperature ) 0.75 % Ropivicaine convert labour epidural analgesia surgical anaesthesia , reduce onset time surgical block , compare standard room temperature
DOC.brief_title: Labour Epidural Top-up With Warmed Ropivacaine
DOC.detailed_description: In prospective , randomise , control , double-blind study ; parturients function labour epidural analgesia require conversion anaesthesia surgical delivery ( SD ) - randomise control intervention group : room temperature ( RT ) body temperature ( BT ) . The control group ( RT ) receive room temperature Ropivacaine 0.75 % , standard practice . The treatment group ( BT ) receive 0.75 % Ropivicaine warm 37°C temperature . Block height assess every 2 minute blind investigator loss sensation cold level T4 , sensation touch use second modality . Primary outcome time loss sensation cold T4 bilaterally assess ethyl-chloride spray . Secondary outcome include motor block , haemodynamic stability , use vasopressor , shiver , sweat , nausea , pruritus , body temperature , intra-operative supplementation , Apgar score .
DOC.criteria: ASA III woman establish labour epidural Labour analgesia standard lowdose mixture PCEA Need surgical delivery Category 1 ( crash ) CS Spinal blockade , suggest migration epidural catheter Use epidural bupivacaine 0.250.5 % within 1 h Pyrexial parturian ≥38°C temperature administration topup Multiply pregnancy Eclampsia An allergy idiosyncratic reaction local anaesthetic Patient refusal
